answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample policies that may be helpful.
This FAQ document from the New York State and Local Retirement Office discusses the policy for someone returning to work in section 212. 
http://www.osc.state.ny.us/retire/publications/vo1648.htm
The Texas Municipals Retirement System has similar information on page two of this document.
http://www.tmrs.org/down/pubs/tmrs_facts.pdf
And here is their Application for Restricted Prior Service Credit.
http://www.tmrs.org/down/forms/TMRS_035R.pdf
The Ohio Public Employees Retirement System has detailed page with information on their Service Credit program.
https://www.opers.org/about/membership/service-credit.shtml
I have also included the Department of Defense document on Portability of Benefits for Moves Between Civil Service and Non- appropriated Fund Employment Systems. It has a lot of general information on their system of service credit.
http://www.cpms.osd.mil/ASSETS/366EB331E445475F9658464254C61704/portabilityhandbook.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gaylene Rhoden
text: We currently do not have a policy for change in employment status as it relates to service year credit. This would impact vacation accumulation. Does anybody have a policy they could share?  I am looking for sample policies that allow someone to receive service year credit when moving from one position to another (either moving from one department to another or moving from part-time to full-time). Also, does anybody have a policy that gives service year credit to anybody who leaves the organization and comes back after a period of time? Thank you.
title: Service Years Credit
